title: Business Live: Pound heads for $1.30 - BBC News
summary: sterling has best month since september .
rbs posts first quarterly profit since 2015 .
nationwide house prices fall for second month .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for another week of business live .
we 'll be back on tuesday from 6am .
enjoy the long weekend !

documents.title: us stocks close lower
text: wall street shares closed lower on friday after data showing the us economy grew at its weakest pace in three years left investors feeling nervous .
the dow jones industrial average fell 0.19 % to 20,940.51 while the s & p 500 also dropped 0.19 % to 2,384.20 .
the tech-heavy nasdaq composite dropped 0.02 % to 6,047.61 .

documents.title: apple urges changes to california self-driving policies
text: apple has publicly asked the state of california to make changes to its proposed self-driving car policies , in the latest sign the firm is pursuing driverless car technology .
in an open letter , it called on the state to revise how companies report self-driving system `` disengagements '' .
it also suggested changes to a proposal `` that may restrict both the design and equipment that can be used in test vehicles to further develop autonomous technologies '' .

others to suggest changes included tesla - which warned against limits on the size of test vehicles - and uber , which said california should allow paying members of the public to ride in autonomous vehicles with drivers .

documents.title: tech tent - fake news and flying cars
text: this content only works in the uk .
on tech tent this week , we seek answers to two questions obsessing the technology world : can we stem the tide of fake news , and perhaps less seriously , how soon can i go to work in a flying car ?
author: BBC Technology

documents.title: shares in carvana bomb in market debut
text: shares in us firm carvana - which uses vending machine-like towers to sell used cars - dived in their market debut on friday .
shares were priced at $ 15 , but opened at $ 13.50 before slumping to $ 12.50 .
the firm sells cars through its website and allows customers to them up from automated `` vending machine '' towers located in us cities such as austin and dallas .
commenting on the float , carvana boss ernie garcia said : `` we 're going to stay focused on what we can control , which is our business and the huge opportunity ahead . ''

documents.title: us stocks edge lower
text: wall street stocks are in negative territory after official data showed the us economy expanded at 0.7 % in the first quarter - its slowest rate in three years .
the dow jones and s & p 500 indexes are both down 0.21 % , while the tech focused nasdaq is 0.08 % lower .

documents.title: shareholders protest against bayer bid for monsanto
text: when bayer announced it was bidding to buy monsanto , the american agricultural corporation , last year it surprised many shareholders and prompted protests by environmental campaigners .
bayer 's annual general meeting took place in bonn on friday - and shareholders and green campaigners voiced their opposition to the $ 66bn deal .
world business report takes a closer look .
author: World Business Report

documents.title: shares in google parent hit all time high
text: shares in google parent alphabet have hit an all-time high after a strong earnings report on thursday .
the firm 's shares are currently up 3.81 % at $ 907.5 having jumped during overnight trading .
earlier they touched $ 916.76 .
first quarter profits at the firm increased 28 % year-on-year to $ 5.4bn ( £ 4.2bn ) , boosted by advertising on mobile phones and the popular youtube video service .

documents.title: royal caribbean shares cruise higher
text: with an 8 % surge , shares in royal caribbean are the biggest winners on the s & p 500 .
it follows the publication of the company 's first quarter results , which were better than expected .
royal caribbean reported a $ 217m net income for the quarter .
it also raised its profit forecast for the whole of the financial year .

documents.title: legless north sea oil platform
text: the first major decommissioning project in the north sea has been completed with the removal of the brent delta platform from its legs .
it has been lifted on to a huge purpose-built ship which will transport it to the north east of england to be scrapped .
the legs will stay in place .
the 24,000 tonne brent delta platform topsides sat on a three-legged gravity-based structure in 140 metres of water .
the shell platform lies 115 miles north east of shetland .
more here from bbc scotland .

documents.title: future of driving electric , says vw boss
text: vw 's chief executive has said the world 's biggest car maker will triple its budget for electric vehicles over the next five years .
speaking at the vienna auto show , matthias müller said most vw cars would still be run by diesel or petrol engines by 2025 , but that the future of driving is electric '' .
as such , the vw group will spend €20bn by 2022 on cleaner engines , while also spending €9bn on electric vehicles - up from €3bn 2012-2017 .

documents.title: royal mail faces union backlash over pensions
text: royal mail is mulling ways to replace the final salary pension scheme it plans to scrap next year following a backlash from unions .
the postal service said it was one of only a few major companies to still have staff in a defined benefit scheme .
but the communications workers union said closure of the plan would result in employees losing up to a third of their future pensions .
around 90,000 royal mail workers are in the scheme , which stopped taking on new members in 2008 .
the company is continuing to hold talks with the cwu as well as unions unite/cma .
unite said : `` if we do n't achieve a satisfactory outcome , we ca n't rule out an industrial action ballot . ''

documents.title: ftse 100 closes lower as pound climbs
text: the ftse 100 has closed 0.46 % lower at 7,203.94 as the pound continued to rise against the dollar .
among the worst performers was barclays - down 5.22 % due to concerns raised in an otherwise strong earnings report .
royal mail fell 3.92 % after the postal group released an update on the future of its pension plan , prompting strike threats from one union .
the pound climbed 0.25 % against the dollar to $ 1.29370 , around its highest level for seven months .
this has put pressure on big firms which lose money when their global profits are converted back to into sterling .

documents.title: oil firm profits jump on price rebound
text: major energy firms have reported their highest profits in a year thanks to a rebound in oil prices .
exxon mobil made $ 4bn profit in the first quarter - more than double what it posted a year ago - while chevron made $ 2.7bn versus a loss last year .
it came a day after french producer total sa reported a 77 % rise in profit .
peers bp and royal dutch shell are set to report quarterly results next week .

documents.title: trump seeks to expand offshore oil drilling
text: us president donald trump has signed an executive designed to expand drilling in the arctic and atlantic oceans .
mr trump ordered his interior secretary to review obama-era rules that restrict where oil firms can drill - the aim being to boost us energy reserves and reduce reliance on foreign oil .
environmental activists have criticised the move , with greenpeace saying it would lock the us `` into decades of harmful pollution '' and devastating spills like the deepwater horizon tragedy .
us interior secretary ryan zinke .
said it woudl foster energy security `` without removing any of the stringent environmental safeguards that are currently in place '' .

documents.title: 'empty streets in sao paulo '
text: polls suggest brazilian president michel temer is very unpopular but up until today he had not yet faced a mass demonstration like friday 's general strike .
many private and public schools are closed across the country .
in sao paulo - the country 's biggest city - most bus , metro and train services are not operating .
there are few people on the streets here and it feels like a holiday .
the government says the current pension system is unsustainable and is dragging down the economy .
unions say the president wants brazil 's poor and unassisted to pay the price for the country 's economic woes .
whatever the turnout is for the protest , mr temer still looks fairly strong in congress .
earlier this week he won a vote for his labour reforms with a wider margin than needed .
this has been the hallmark of his administration : a president who is very unpopular in the streets , but is able to get things done in congress .
author: Daniel Gallas
BBC South America business correspondent

documents.title: brazil hit by first general strike in two decades
text: brazilian cities went into partial shutdown on friday as the country observed its first general strike in more than two decades .
millions of workers , including public transport staff , bankers and teachers , have been urged to take part by trade unions and social groups .
protesters are taking a stand against the president 's proposed pension reforms .
president michel temer says the changes are needed to overcome a recession .
read more .

documents.title: rbs 'sorry ' for app issues
text: earlier we reported that the rbs/ natwest app failed for nearly an hour this morning , sparking complaints from customers .
rbs - which owns natwest - now says it has fixed the issue and has apologised .
our mobile apps and online banking are now running as normal and delayed payments are starting to credit customer accounts .
we apologise for the inconvenience caused . ''
it also clarified that the issue with payments only affected natwest , not rbs or ulster bank .
and it said the payments issue only affected some payments made from natwest accounts - people 's incoming salary payments were unaffected .

documents.title: ftse 100 's disappointing month
text: michael hewson , chief market analyst at cmc markets uk , says the ftse 100 has not only had a disappointing week , it 's also had a disappointing month .
`` it has given up all of its march gains in the process , as a rebound in the pound , weak basic resources , and some weakness in the banks weigh on the index , '' he says .
however , he notes that ftse 250 is set to close higher for the fifth month in succession , despite an over 5 % rise in the value of the pound from its march lows .
`` it suggests the sterling effect is a little overstated .
let 's not forget the pound is only 7 % away from 30 year lows against the us dollar , not exactly a big amount . ''

documents.title: rbs and natwest fix app issuebbc personal finance correspondent tweets
text: rbs/natwest says has solved problem which felled its app and slowed payments , but backlog of payments will take till end of day to clear
they want us to use bitcoin

documents.title: eurozone growth 'could outplace uk and us '
text: with the eurozone expected to post quarterly growth of 0.5 % next week , the bloc could now be outpacing the us and the uk , says kathleen brooks , an analyst at city index .
`` the eurozone has had a surge in better than expected growth recently , '' she says .
she said citi 's own economic sentiment surveys suggest the us and uk economies are starting to hit the skids at the same time as europe 's economy is putting its foot on the gas '' .

documents.title: mixed start for us stocks
text: us stocks have started mostly flat after the weak gdp figures published earlier , but the tech-focused nasdaq continues to rise .
shortly after the bell the dow jones index was down 0.1 % at 20,961.53 , while the broader based s & p 500 was flat at 2,389.03 .
but the nasdaq - which hit a fresh closing high yesterday - had climbed 0.26 % to 6,064.55 .

documents.title: qualcomm issues profit warning as apple withholds royalties
text: qualcomm has slashed its revenue forecasts following a decision by apple to withhold royalty payments owed to the chip maker .
the company said it would not receive any royalties from apple for sales until a legal dispute was resolved .
it comes after apple sued qualcomm in january , accusing it of overcharging for chips and refusing to pay some $ 1 billion in promised rebates .
on friday an apple spokesperson said : `` without an agreed-upon rate to determine how much is owed , we have suspended payments until the correct amount can be determined by the court . ''
qualcomm , the largest maker of chips used in smartphones , said it now expects sales of $ 4.8bn- $ 5.6bn for its third quarter , down from the $ 5.3bn- $ 6.1bn it had previously expected .
it said its contract terms with apple had not changed in a decade .

documents.title: pound wobbles
text: the pound has also dipped following weak gdp figures from the us , although it 's still above $ 1.29 - its best level for seven months .
it 's currently trading 0.03 % higher against the dollar at $ 1.29090 .

documents.title: us sees slow start to 2017bbc business presenter tweets
text: us economy grew 0.7 % at start of 2017 , slowest pace in 3 years

documents.title: us gdp 'not as bad as it looks '
text: nancy curtin , chief investment officer at close brothers asset management , says us gdp figures for the first quarter are n't as bad as they look .
us gdp figures are ty weaker in q1 so this reading is in line with the seasonal trend .
we have n't yet had the expected fiscal stimulus from trump , the effects of which may not be seen until the end of this year or the start of 2018 .

while investors might be disappointed with the reading , it has been a steady start to the year with inflation looking benign , a resilient jobs market and positive pmi data , all likely to boost returns for investors . ''

documents.title: dollar dips
text: the greenback has n't taken well to the latest quarterly us growth figures .
it 's down 0.37 % against the euro at 0.91620 euros .

documents.title: us grows at weakest pace in three years
text: us economic growth in the first three months of donald trump 's presidency has slowed to the weakest rate since the first quarter of 2014 .
in the first of three readings of gdp , the us economy fell below expectations of 1 % growth because of shrinking business inventories and reduced public spending .
mr trump had promised to lift us economic growth to 4 % .
treasury secretary steven mnuchin has said the administration can achieve 3 % growth by the end of 2018 , helped by tax cuts and deregulation .

documents.title: breakingus gdp growth slows
text: the us economy grew at 0.7 % in the first quarter , compared to 2.1 % in the final three months of 2016 .

documents.title: bmw workers target 'posh ' showroom
text: what will the neighbors say ?
bmw workers are set to stage a protest outside the german car-maker 's upmarket showroom on london 's park lane on saturday as part of a dispute over pensions .
members of the unite union will take part in the demonstration ahead of a further six days of industrial action at bmw plants around the country .
bmw angered workers when it announced plans to close its final salary pension scheme .

unite national officer fred hanna , said : `` we will be highlighting this 'pension robbery ' and the refusal of bmw to talk about affordable options to keep the scheme open when we protest outside the car maker 's posh park lane showroom . ''

documents.title: big demand drives gm profits
text: when it comes to transport , america likes its vehicles big .
for general motors ( gm ) , demand for trucks and `` crossovers '' - otherwise known as suvs - powered a sharp rise in first quarter profit to $ 2.6bn ( £ 2bn ) .
from $ 1.95bn .
revenue rose 10.6 % to $ 41.2bn .
in europe , earnings before interest and tax shrank by 0.2 % in the three months to march .
gm also revealed that its european market share fell to 5.9 % from 6.2 % .
gm agreed to sell its european opel and vauxhall business to france 's psa group .

documents.title: jeff bezos is loadsamoney
text: good news for amazon founder jeff bezos .
business editor simon jack tweets :
move over bill - jeff bezos just $ 5 billion away from being richest man in the world .
good news is the last 5bn is easier than the first
elon > bezos

documents.title: sell in may and go away ?
text: the old stock market adage - `` sell in may and go away and come on back on st leger 's day '' - suggests divesting shares then buying them again in september .
but what if it 's an election year ?
before the last poll in may 2015 , investors withdrew £ 2.7bn from uk equity funds according to the investment association .

but laith khalaf at hargreaves lansdown does not expect this to be repeated : `` in the forthcoming election the winner looks more certain , on paper at least , and there is less time for investors to fret about the outcome . ''
however there are a number of factors that could influence the markets , such as commodity prices .
`` selling ahead of the election is therefore no more than a bit of a punt .
worse still , it requires investors to take another random bet further down the line , on when to jump back into the market , '' mr khalaf said .

documents.title: southern strike hits house prices
text: house price growth has slowed to about a third of its previous levels in areas hit by the southern train strikes , according to zoopla .
the growth rates for property prices in towns across the southern network rose by 3 % in the 12 months to april , compared with a 9.1 % rise for the preceding 12 months .
the property website found 91 % of towns served by southern had suffered seen property value growth weaken over the past year .
house price growth has slowed in recent months , zoopla said , with a 2.5 % rise over the past year , compared with a 6.6 % increase for the previous 12 months .

documents.title: on the up
text: resolution foundation chief economist matt whittaker tweets :
latest gdp figures came out this morning , so what 's the growth backdrop to the election ?
overall , uk recovery looks good internationally
but when you switch to a measure of growth per person , the uk drops down the league table
setting uk 's performance alongside pvs recoveries highlights sustained post-crisis fall out : 9 years on output per person just 1.7 % higher
latest quarter-on-quarter growth of just 0.1 % driven by retail slowdown and apparent consumer cutbacks in the face of rising inflation
the growth slowdown also implies slower productivity growth at the start of 2017 .
should be priority # 1 for whoever forms next goverment
and when you factor in increased spending by overseas visitors thanks to the fall in the £ , things are even worse for uk residents .
if you did a trend line from financial crisis , it looks woeful in terms of where we could have been .
apart from japan , others not so bad .
italy 's relegation confirmed .
sad they are in second division with brazil , argentina , thailand etc .
italy looks dangerously slow to recover

documents.title: sweet and savoury
text: telegraph retail editor ashley armstrong tweets :
sainsbury 's is trialling patisserie valerie & sushi counters in its supermarkets in latest sign of retailers stuffing shop with leisure offers
pat valerie seems new ; sushi has been in harrogate since late last year .
nine elms also has sushi

documents.title: cybercrime takes its toll
text: new figures published today by the office of national statistics reveal the extent of cybercrime facing both individuals and businesses .
there were 11.5 million incidents of cybercrime last year according to the according to the ons .
it is the first time it has published an annual tally for these offences and means four in every 100 adults were affected .
there were as many as 1.8 million cases of fraud related to bank cards in 2016 - a 22 % rise on the previous year - according to the ons .
steve snaith , head of technology risk assurance at rsm , said : 'we know that cyber criminals are becoming ever more sophisticated , and these figures clearly demonstrate how prevalent attacks .
have become .
businesses must ensure that effective control systems are put in place to minimise the risks of a successful breach . ''

documents.title: rbs/natwest failure
text: the rbs and natwest banking app failed for nearly an hour this morning .
the rbs group said both app and online banking were still running slowly .
many customers have been complaining on social media that payments and money transfers have not been getting through .
an rbs spokesman said some but not most of its millions of customers were affected , adding no customers would be left out of pocket .
the bank has not yet issued an explanation for the problem .

documents.title: pension fund hits out at akzo
text: one of britain 's biggest pension scheme investors has called on dulux paint owner akzo nobel to hold talks with ppg industries over a revised takeover bid , and criticised its handling of the issue .

the universities superannuation scheme , which manages assets worth about £ 57bn on behalf of 375,000 savers , said a revised $ 29bn bid from ppg was high enough for `` meaningful and constructive '' dialogue to begin `` in earnest '' .

daniel summerfield of uss said akzo 's decision to refuse a request for an extraordinary shareholder meeting `` not only undermines the credibility of the board but portrays dutch governance in a very negative light '' .
uss has a 1.28 % stake in akzo , making it a top 10 investor , according to thomson reuters data .

documents.title: sony returns to form
text: sony expects to post its largest full-year operating profit for 20 years helped by its playstation console business .
profit for the year to march 2018 is forecast to reach 500bn yen ( £ 3.4bn ) , the best figure since 525.7bn yen in 1998 , as the company emerges from a major restructure
as well as gaming , sony has enjoyed strong sales of image sensors used in products such as smartphone cameras .
yasuo imanaka , an analyst at rakuten securities , says : `` its gaming sector remains a strong earnings driver , while the tv and camera businesses are steadily recovering too .
one concern is the fate of its film division .
it will take time to put it back on a recovery track . ''

documents.title: no rate rise til 2019 ?
text: jamie mcgeever of reuters tweets :
`` the uk economy has begun to feel the post-referendum slowdown '' so bank of england to keep rates on hold until at least 2019 - barclays
key snippet
so why is it growing faster than france even post a slowdown ? ? ? ? ! ! !
but what if prices keep going up in the shops .
stagflation here we come ?

documents.title: traders take a bite out of barclays
text: barclays has fallen further and is now down 5.3 % at 212.1p .
jordan hiscott at ayondo markets says underneath the bank 's higher profits is a `` markedly lower performance in the trading units , particularly equities and fixed income '' .
he also said brexit-linked staff relocation costs and the reverberations of chief executive jes staley 's attempt to out a whistleblower are weighing on barclays .
after jumping a whopping 17 % yesterday , mediclinic international is today 's biggest faller , down 4.7 % at 818p .
morrisons led the risers , up 2.2 % ahead of results next week along with rival supermarket sainsbury 's .
the ftse 100 is down about 20 points at 7,217 , while the pound is higher at $ 1.293 despite a bigger-than-expected slowdown in gdp growth in the first quarter .

documents.title: hold your horses
text: ben brettell , senior economist at hargreaves lansdown , cautions against becoming too pessimistic at friday 's gdp figure : this is only the first of three readings of uk economic growth .
`` 2017 looks set to be a year of slower growth , as higher inflation puts the squeeze on consumers ' real incomes ahead of june 's general election and the start of brexit negotiations .

the economy has surprised since last summer 's referendum , powered by a resilient consumer , but it looks like households are now starting to feel the pinch from the current bout of inflation , '' he says .

documents.title: natwest : customers will not be out of pocket
text: personal finance correspondent simon gompertz tweets :
natwest `` aware of some issues with app investigating reports of issue with online banking would not be left out of pocket ''

documents.title: natwest banking app packs up on payday
text: personal finance correspondent simon gompertz tweets :
natwest customers complaining app and online banking not working - and it 's payday .
babies to feed , bills to pay says one
yes simon , it appears to be a major problem .
i can not buy lunch because of it .
both app and website appear to be down .
payments failing too .
natwest customers saying online money transfers disappearing into a black hole - i.e .
they ca n't see where cash has gone
may be a generic issue ?
cash transfer to my missus via @ twitterid app just disappeared into an error message as well
hi romily , that seems strange ; can you tell what error message you 've received ?
sheree
it said there was a problem , but not to repeat the transaction and instead check back in four hours .
not handy for my missus at the checkout
we 're aware of this issue and i would recommend following the advice given .
i do apologise for any inconvenience caused .
sheree
also , appear unable to pay any bills using my # natwest debit card .

documents.title: eurozone inflation rises to 1.9 %
text: eurozone inflation rose to 1.9 % in april , eurostat says - up from 1.5 % in march .
the rate was higher than the 1.8 % expected by analysts and is edging closer to the european central bank 's target of 2 % .

documents.title: uk economic growth trails spain
text: busy day for economic news : uk q1 gdp growth 0.3 % .
french q1 gdp growth 0.3 % .
spanish q1 gdp growth 0.8 % .

documents.title: sorrell pay slashed
text: poor sir martin sorrell !
the wpp chief had to make do with being paid a mere £ 48m last year - down almost a third from the bumper £ 70m in 2015 .
the slide is due to the falling value of his long-term share incentive scheme , which was worth just over £ 41m .
short-term bonuses accounted for almost £ 3m , with his salary at £ 3.6m .
a third of investors voted against wpp 's remuneration policy at the most recent annual meeting and the firm will hope sir martin 's lower pay will keep shareholders a bit less grumpy .
shares in wpp are down 8 % so far this year .

documents.title: mortgage approvals sink
text: british banks approved the fewest mortgages in four months in march and consumer credit growth slowed , adding to signs of a weakening in economic growth in early 2017 .
banks approved 41,061 mortgages for house purchase last month , down from 42,247 in february , the british bankers ' association said .
annual consumer lending growth slowed to 6.1 % from 6.5 % in february , easing further from october 's 10-year high of 7.2 % .

documents.title: consumers lead gdp slowdownpantheon macroeconomics chief uk economist samuel tombs tweets
text: the fall in output in the distribution , hotels and restaurants sectors shows that the slowdown in uk gdp growth in q1 was led by consumers :
uk gdp annual growth 2.1 % - returns to head the oecd growth leader board .

documents.title: 'not too severe '
text: ruth gregory at capital economics remains reasonably optimistic , even if today 's gdp figure makes hitting 2 % growth for the year a bit trickier .
the forward-looking indicators of the business surveys suggest that a decent amount of momentum has carried through into the second quarter .

what 's more , this morning 's resilient consumer confidence figures offer support to our view that fairly strong employment growth , upbeat sentiment and loose monetary conditions should ensure that spending growth moderates , rather than collapses .
so although there are many challenges ahead - not least further rises in inflation this year - we do n't think any slowdown this year will be too severe . ''

documents.title: squeezed
text: another snapshot of the gdp figures from economics correspondent andy verity :
so now we have a ) a renewed squeeze on living standards with no growth in real wages and b ) a sharp slowdown .
here 's perspective :
keep watching that consumer debt build and note boe last financial stability report on deterioration in loan defaults

documents.title: do n't panic yet
text: nancy curtin , chief investment officer at close brothers asset management , says : `` rising inflation and slow wage growth have dampened consumer demand and reduced retail spending , which were helping drive growth last year after britain 's vote to leave the eu . ''
but she says that the fall in the pound since last year 's referendum has helped exports .

`` with the general election just around the corner and brexit negotiations afoot , any dip in the economy risks bringing further caution and uncertainty to businesses , which has a knock on effect when it comes to investment and employment , '' ms curtin comments .

`` however the chancellor , with better than expected budget tax receipts in his pocket , has room for manoeuvre and should be able to pre-empt any further slowdown which should help with business confidence . ''

documents.title: services weighs on gdp
text: services proved to be the main drag on economic growth as inflation has grown to 2.3 % - above the bank of england 's 2 % target .
the services sector , which accounts for nearly three quarters of the uk economy , grew by 0.3 % in the first quarter , down from a 0.8 % expansion in the final three months of 2016 .

documents.title: break it down
text: economics correspondent andy verity tweets :
if you break it down to economic growth per person ( gdp per capita ) - growth in q1 was only 0.1 % ( ons )
imo gdp per capita much more relevant than total gdp .
by this measure i suspect post-gfc recovery even more anaemic than politicians claim

documents.title: retail depresses gdp growth
text: the office for national statistics ( ons ) said that retail and accommodation were the biggest contributors to the slower growth in gdp between january and march .
`` these industries were impacted by increases in prices , '' the ons said .
however , year on year , gdp growth was stronger at 2.1 % compared to a previous 1.9 % .

documents.title: breakinguk gdp growth slows to 0.3 %
text: the uk economy grew at 0.3 % in the first three months of this year , according to the office for national statistics , down from 0.7 % in the final quarter of 2016 .
the first reading of gdp is far below estimates of between 04 % -0.5 % growth .

documents.title: today 's business podcast
text: business presenter rob young tweets :
my # business # podcast : # trump100days assessment , state of uk economy , asia investors & # ukhousing , # barclays woes -
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: eu ramps up tough talk
text: german chancellor angela merkel said on thursday that britons should have no illusions that the uk must sort out its divorce from the eu before striking trade deals .
now european council president donald tusk has chimed in :
before discussing eu-uk future , we must first sort out our past .
this is the only possible approach to brexit talks .
moaning inside , moaning outside .
you must give it to the british , they are very consistent .
um , it 's the eu whinging about not doing parallel talks .
no , that 's called being logical and looking after the interest of the citizens of the 27 member states .
no , it 's entirely illogical to force the uk to make concessions before we agree what we get in return .
it 's not `` concessions '' ; it 's settling commitments made by successive uk governments ( of their own will ) over a long period of time .
that 's simply not true .
the eu is demanding the uk funds unfunded pension liabilities we never agreed to .
absolutely not true .
the uk can always leave without paying and become a pariah state if you prefer will help a lot for new trade deals
we absolutely should do .
we can use the savings to subsidise exports .
given we have a trade deficit , we can use net tariff cash too .
that we and our allies in ww2 saved you all from a fate worse than death .
so you owe us and not just in monetary terms .
thats what we really owe
clearly the eu is unwilling to be constructive .
we should leave eastern europe to the russians .
nothing suprise me in your thought , as always , history love to make circles
why should british people pay to protect a union that 's trying to split up the uk ?
why ?
in a divorce future payments can be offset against a one-off settlement of current assets , and vice versa .
you agree both together .
it 's not a divorce , you 're getting muddled by trying to hold on to this analogy
in this case , the idea of balancing future benefits against a one-off payment now is still true .
not sure what you mean ?
are you toying with idea of uk not paying ?
correct me if misunderstanding
not paying what ?
it 's you that mentioned payments
if the eu are demanding that we pay tens of billions before knowing what we will get in return then , yes , i would suggest not doing that .
we will know , it will be a fully documented total .
unlike the uk the eu is well prepared .

documents.title: sterling heads for $ 1.30
text: sterling climbed to its highest since late september on friday , approaching $ 1.30 as traders await gdp figures at 930am .
sterling rose 0.3 % to as high as $ 1.2939 in morning trade in london .
on the last trading day of april , it was up almost 3 percent on the month - its best performance since march 2016 , before the vote for brexit .
the pound is now just under 14 % against the dollar since the eu referendum , having fallen as much as 23.5 % to a 31-year low of $ 1.1491 in october .

documents.title: just eat boss on leave
text: takeaway delivery firm just eat says executive chairman john hughes is taking a leave of absence for medical treatment .
chief financial officer paul harrison will become interim chief executive as just eat searches for a permanent replacement .
senior independent director andrew griffiths will act as non-executive chairman .
just eat shares are down 0.4 % after falling as low as 2.8 % earlier .
dr hughes also chairs spectris , the `` productivity-enhancing instrumentation and controls company '' .
it is now worth £ 3.2bn after a 45 % rise in the share price over the past 12 months .

documents.title: sunny skies or stormy outlook for staley ?
text: business editor simon jack has been taking a close look at those barclays numbers and what they mean for chief executive jes staley 's future .
barclays outlook bright says boss whose own future is under a cloud .
my blog

documents.title: confidence in question
text: samuel tombs of pantheon marcroeconomics tweets :
the further tick down in consumer confidence in april hints the conservatives might not get the triple-digit majority they 're hoping for :
why do you think 97 was such an outlier ?
any lessons for 2017 ?
clearly , con .
conf .
is n't everything .
tb had much higher approval rating than jm .
con .
will benefit this time from jc 's percieved weakness
so what happened in 1997 ?

documents.title: rbs : from ugly ducking to swan ?
text: laith khalaf at hargreaves lansdown says rbs has been `` quick off the blocks in 2017 '' , after beating first quarter profit expectations .

however , he notes : `` it 's too early to pop the champagne corks though , because the us department of justice is likely to play the role of party pooper at some point by landing rbs with a massive fine .

mr khalaf also says the williams & glyn separation could end up costing rbs more cash , but adds : `` these longstanding problems aside , this could be the year when rbs finally starts to look a bit more like a swan , rather than an ugly duckling . ''

documents.title: greggs chairman adds dfs
text: the chairman of greggs , that purveyor of delicious cheese and onion pasties and the like , is adding another string to his bow by taking on the same role at dfs furniture .
ian durant will start in his new role on 2 may and takes over from richard baker .
he also chairs capital and counties properties .

documents.title: barclays fails to impress
text: analysts at jefferies are not too impressed with the barclays results .
they say the `` primary culprit '' was us revenue in the investment bank and a miss on costs that could be partially due to foreign exchange fluctuations .
`` we do not see estimates rising on the back of today 's results .
remain `` hold '' on the shares , '' jefferies said .

documents.title: taxpayers almost rid of lloyds
text: the treasury has reduced its stake in lloyds banking group to less than 1 % .
uk financial investments , which manages the holding in lloyds , has reduced its stake by about half to 0.89 % .
last week , chancellor philip hammond said the government has recouped the £ 20.3bn used to bail out lloyds during the financial crisis after the bank rescued hbos .

documents.title: breakingftse struggles
text: london is a touch higher at the open , with barclays falling almost 3 % .
rbs , however , is up 3.4 % , bringing gains this year for the bank to more than 16 % .

documents.title: wake up once more
text: and speaking of wake up to money , if you missed today 's edition 5 live business producer justin bones has handily tweeted a link to the podcast !
listen : today 's wake up to money @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: barclays ' african hit
text: wake up to money presenter louise cooper tweets :
barclays takes huge £ 884mn charge on african biz which hits profits .
one off charges proving yet again they are mis-named
'recurring one-offs '
the key question for all these banks is when they stop being recurring .
because underlying profitability now recovering strongly .
think it comes back to these banks having too much going on and still being 'too big to fail ' .
reduce complexity reduce cock ups , in theory
as large as africa is yet barclays ca n't make profits ?
i blame lazy incentive schemes .
far easier to sit in canary wharf & get bonuses

documents.title: a tale of two banks
text: rbs and barclays have reported good first quarter numbers , but both banks continue to face major issues .
ismail erturk at manchester business school tells bbc radio 4 's today programme that rbs still has to pay a multi-billion dollar penalty to the us for mis-selling toxic mortgage debt .
it has set aside £ 6.7bn to cover us litigation costs .
meanwhile , the whiff of the barclays whistleblowing controversy continues to taint chief executive jes staley .
investment adviser iss is telling shareholders to abstain on the vote to re-elect mr staley at barclays ' annual meeting .

mr erturk says : `` the whole problem in banking , especially barclays , is [ with ] the kind of fines they paid with the libor fixing , you still have these governance issues and if people can not trust the top management then how can you trust them to build a long-term strategy for the bank ? ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: housing trouble ahead ?
text: samuel tombs at pantheon macroeconomics says falling consumer confidence and declining real wages are `` really starting to depress the housing market '' .
however , intense competition among lenders looks set to drive down mortgage rates further this year , boosting the size of loans that some households can afford .
but the loan-to-income ratio rule introduced in 2014 means leverage can not rise much further .
`` real wages still look set to fall by about 0.5 % this year and employment intentions remain below pre-referendum norms .
as a result , we continue to expect year-over-year growth in house prices to moderate to just 2 % by the end of this year . ''

documents.title: trump spooks hyundai investors
text: we 've seen time and time again how the words of the us president can spook markets and today it 's south korea 's turn .
in a reuters interview , president trump branded a free trade pact with south korea as `` terrible '' for the us - saying he wants to renegotiate it .
with cars one of the biggest south korean exports to the us , the industry body says it 's concerned over the possibility of revising the deal .
hyundai motor shares fell 2 % after mr trump 's comments .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: future is bright , says rbs
text: rbs is sticking to its forecast that it will return to profit by the end of 2018 .
chief executive ross mcewan says : `` these results reflect very much what we talked about at full year .
firstly , a strong and improving core bank and secondly , fewer remaining legacy issues .
core income is up on last year , adjusted costs are down , and we 're making better use of capital .

this bank has a very strong core with great potential , and we believe that by going further on cost reduction and faster on digital transformation - we will deliver a simpler , safer and even more customer-focused bank , with a compelling investment case . ''

documents.title: house prices fall in april
text: uk house prices fell for a second consecutive month in april , according to mortgage lender nationwide .
prices declined by a monthly 0.4 % following a fall of 0.3 % in march - the first fall since mid-2015 .
however , in annual terms prices were 2.6 % higher - the weakest increase in almost four years .

`` while monthly figures can be volatile , the recent softening in price growth may be a further indication that households are starting to react to the emerging squeeze on real incomes or to affordability pressures in key parts of the country , '' nationwide economist robert gardner said .
economists .
reuters had expected house prices to rise 0.1 % in april and by 3.3 % in annual terms .

documents.title: rbs second quarter profits to fall
text: despite returning to profit in the first quarter , clouds remain over rbs .
the bank , which is still majority-owned by the uk taxpayer , has retained its guidance for 2017 .
however , it expects operating profit to be lower in the second quarter because of an expected fall in income from its investment banking arm , as well a rise in operating expenses .
the bank adds that it book a gain of £ 160m next quarter from the sale of its stake in payments business vocalink .

documents.title: barclays to add 2,000 jobs
text: barclays chief executive jes staley says the bank plans to hire about 2,000 new staff in the uk in the next three years focused on technology .
he tells bloomberg it wants to bring technology development back in house and reduce reliance on external contractors .
while he says the bank is investing in the uk , mr staley admits it will also increase the number of staff based in the european union .

documents.title: breakingbarclays more than doubles profit
text: barclays more than doubled first quarter pre-tax profit to £ 1.6bn compared to a previous £ 793m .

documents.title: breakingrbs returns to profit
text: rbs has reported a first quarter profit of £ 259m compared to a £ 968m loss in the same period last year .
it is the bank 's first quarterly profit since the july-september period in 2015 .
operating profit also improved to £ 1.3bn from £ 1.02bn .

documents.title: that 's not just a grocery delivery
text: so would you order your tasty treats and fancy ready meals from m & s if it goes ahead with an online food delivery service ?
give us your thoughts : bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: french gdp misses forecasts
text: france 's economic growth has slowed to 0.3 % in the first quarter compared to 0.5 % in the final three months of 2016 .
analysts had forecast a rise of 0.4 % .
france is in the process of electing a new president and the final two candidates , emmanuel macron and marine le pen , face a number of economic challenges .

documents.title: yeah baby she 's got it
text: guess who will be on breakfast this morning ?
only the world 's most successful girl group - bananarama !
we are excited about welcoming @ twitterid on the sofa later and so are the team @ twitterid @ twitterid
stop dumbing down and grow up , the programme has become a joke
it fun or u not heard of fun
class what a great little video well done all
well done @ twitterid - yet again hitting the spot !
this was freekin awwwwsum @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: uk boom is bust
text: we will learn today how much the uk economy has expanded in the first quarter .
the expectation is the gdp rate slowed to between 0.4 % and 0.5 % from 0.7 % in the final three months of 2016 .
justin urquhart stewart of seven investment management tells bbc radio 4 's today programme : `` we are coming to the end of a consumer boom . ''
he says that the uk has a high level of consumer debt and people are `` very fearful '' of an interest rate rise , which would lift mortgage costs .
on the corporate side , mr urquhart stewart says that while companies are continuing to invest it is mainly in the short-term because of the uncertainty over brexit .
one key measure to look out for is how much inward investment the uk is attracting , he says .
previously , the uk was third after the us and china for foreign investment but he questions whether that rate will continue .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: volvo motors on
text: volvo cars , now owned by china 's geely of course , said operating profit rose 11 % in the first quarter following strong demand for the xc60 ( and 90 series cars .
profits rose to 400m to 3.5bn swedish crowns ( £ 307m ) on sales 5.6bn higher at 47.6bn crowns .
geely bought the swedish car maker from ford in 2010 .

documents.title: amazon rakes it in
text: just in case you missed it last night , amazon posted a 23 % jump in sales to $ 35.7bn for the three months to march 31 - better than analysts predicted .
net profit for the online giant more than trebled to $ 724m .
read a full wrap of last night 's results from amazon , google and microsoft here .

documents.title: ubs beats profit forecasts
text: switzerland 's ubs has made a positive start to the year after reporting a 79 % rise in first quarter net profit to 1.3bn swiss francs ( £ 1bn ) .
analysts had forecast profit of 919m swiss francs .
the bank attributed the rise to investment banking and wealth management as well as continuing to cut costs .

looking ahead , ubs was cautiously optimistic , stating that while the global recovery is likely to continue , `` macroeconomic uncertainty , geopolitical tensions and divisive politics pose risks that may affect client sentiment and transaction volumes '' .

documents.title: m & s eyes online market
text: the guardian reports that marks & spencer will trial an online grocery shopping service later this year after conceding it could no longer ignore the fastest-growing segment of the market .
`` we continue to review food online carefully .
it has not cost us anything over the last five years by not being online with food .
our customers have n't moved yet , but they will and we need to ensure that we are ready with the right response , '' said chief executive steve rowe (
`` there are unanswered questions over what this means for m & s and we have a team looking at this now with a view to undertaking a soft trial in the autumn , '' he said .
extensive trials will take place before m & s introduces a wider online grocery service .

`` the economics of food online are not straightforward and it is not something that we are going to rush into until we have substantial customer insight and a better understanding of what is right for m & s and right for our customers , '' he added .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to the last business live for the week - yes it 's friday and it 's a bank holiday weekend ( in the uk at least ) , but there is a busy day ahead , with results from both barclays and royal bank of scotland at 7am , followed by gdp figures from the uk , europe and the us too .
as always get in touch at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk or follow me on twitter at @ twitterid
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News
